title: DN404 vs ERC404
description: Introducing DN404, Revolutionizing the NFT Space with Innovative Fractionalization

body.raw:
## Token Minting and Burning Mechanism

- **Minting NFTs**: When a user accumulates at least one base unit (10^18) of the ERC20 tokens, an NFT is automatically minted to their address. This process follows as the user continues to accumulate each subsequent base unit of tokens.
  
- **Burning NFTs**: If the user's token balance falls below a base unit threshold, the most recently minted NFT is burned. This mechanism is similar to the one employed in ERC404, ensuring a dynamic balance between the base tokens and their corresponding NFTs.

## Mirror Contract Compliance and Functionality

- **ERC721 Compliance**: The mirror contract adheres strictly to the ERC721 standard, ensuring compatibility with all protocols supporting ERC721 tokens.
  
- **Automated NFT Minting and Burning**: As the base ERC20 tokens are transferred, the corresponding mirrored NFTs are minted and burned automatically, maintaining a consistent representation of ownership.

## DN404's Innovation and Goal

- **Native Fractionalization**: DN404's primary objective is to introduce a token standard that embodies both NFT and fractionalization properties. This innovation, initially seen in ERC404, enables users to trade portions of NFTs directly, without intermediaries.
  
- **Beyond ERC1155**: While some may compare DN404 to ERC1155 tokens, DN404 stands apart by enabling NFTs to be traded both on dedicated NFT exchanges and decentralized exchanges (DEXes). This dual functionality enhances liquidity for NFT projects.

## Code Optimization and Risk Disclaimer

- **Code Optimization**: The code has undergone extensive optimization, thanks to @optimizoor, known for Solady and ERC721A contributions.
  
- **Disclaimer**: The code is yet to undergo a formal audit. Users are advised to use it at their own risk, and the developers do not assume liability for any potential exploits.

title: Arthur Hayes Predicts Market Crash, Ethereum Bull Revival
description: Arthur Hayes warns of a short-term market crash following Fed rate cuts but sees Ethereum bull market revival ahead.

body.raw:
üì∞ Arthur Hayes, former CEO of BitMEX, has issued a stark warning to the crypto community: a short-term market crash is looming following the Federal Reserve‚Äôs rate cuts. 
        However, he also believes that this temporary downturn could set the stage for a new Ethereum bull market revival.

        Hayes points to financial stress in the traditional markets as a key factor that could cause a broader sell-off in crypto assets. As liquidity tightens and investors 
        move to safer assets, a market dip could be imminent. But Hayes is not all doom and gloom; in fact, he remains bullish on Ethereum in the medium to long term.

        The reason for this optimism lies in Ethereum‚Äôs ongoing development and growing use cases. The network‚Äôs upcoming upgrades and increasing adoption in DeFi and NFT 
        ecosystems could serve as a catalyst for a price resurgence. Moreover, Ethereum‚Äôs role as the backbone of decentralized applications positions it well for future growth.

        Hayes‚Äôs prediction underscores the volatility inherent in the crypto markets but also highlights the potential for significant upside once the dust settles. 
        For those willing to weather the storm, Ethereum could represent a strong opportunity for long-term gains.

title: Bitcoin and Ethereum On the Verge of New Highs: Updates You Can‚Äôt Miss!
description: Find out why Bitcoin and Ethereum are primed for explosive growth, and what key indicators are pushing these cryptos to the brink of new all-time highs.

body.raw:
üöÄ **Bitcoin and Ethereum Set for Explosive Growth: October 2024 Updates** October has been nothing short of thrilling for Bitcoin and Ethereum investors. As the month progresses, these two titans of the crypto world are flashing signals of massive potential gains. Let‚Äôs dive into what‚Äôs fueling their momentum.
### üìà Bitcoin on Track for New All-Time Highs Bitcoin is back in the spotlight as analysts predict a run toward **$70,000 and beyond**. Several factors are contributing to this surge, including reduced supply on exchanges, with Bitcoin reserves hitting a five-year low. This signals that traders are holding onto their BTC, expecting further gains. In addition, institutional interest remains strong, with over **$500 million** flowing into Bitcoin ETFs in mid-October alone. Many experts suggest that this uptick could lead to a historic bull run, with some even forecasting Bitcoin to potentially reach **$233,000** in 2025 [source](https://cointelegraph.com) [source](https://dailyhodl.com).
### üèóÔ∏è Ethereum‚Äôs ETF Surge and Network Challenges Ethereum is also making headlines, primarily due to the launch of the **Monochrome Ethereum ETF** on the Cboe Australia exchange, following the success of Bitcoin ETFs earlier this year. This move has been celebrated as a milestone for Ethereum‚Äôs mainstream adoption, although challenges remain. Despite the recent rise in **ETH gas fees by 498%**, Ethereum has shown strength against Bitcoin, and there‚Äôs a growing sentiment that a move toward **$3,000** could be in sight by year-end [source](https://cointelegraph.com) [source](https://dailyhodl.com).
### üîç Key Catalysts to Watch For Bitcoin, the Federal Reserve‚Äôs recent **rate cut of 50 basis points** has fueled optimism, with analysts predicting this could trigger a sharp upward trend. Meanwhile, Ethereum‚Äôs ecosystem continues to expand, but network congestion remains a concern. As Ethereum works through these scaling issues, solutions like **Layer 2** protocols and staking improvements could accelerate its growth [source](https://techbullion.com).
Stay tuned as Bitcoin and Ethereum continue their upward trajectory. Will Bitcoin hit new highs, or will Ethereum‚Äôs rally outpace the rest of the market? We‚Äôre in for an exciting Q4 2024!

title: New Etherscan Product
description: Exploring the Decentralized Web with Blockscan

body.raw:
## Exploring the Decentralized Web with Blockscan

<Image src="/etherscan.png" width="500" height="275" alt="Etherscan" className='mx-auto'/>

In the rapidly evolving world of blockchain and decentralized technologies, navigating this new landscape can be daunting. Enter Blockscan, a revolutionary search engine designed to simplify your journey through the decentralized web. Officially launched by the same team behind Etherscan, Blockscan enables users to explore websites on .eth, .crypto, and .zil domains, with many more to come.

Blockscan aims to be the Google of the decentralized web. Whether you're curious about a specific blockchain address or just browsing, Blockscan has you covered. The platform allows users to kickstart their journey by browsing through a directory of 150 known websites. This feature provides a curated entry point into the vast and often fragmented world of decentralized sites, ensuring users can easily find relevant and interesting content.

One of Blockscan's standout features is its ability to cross-reference addresses across multiple chains. With just a click on the Blockscan icon, users can see if an address appears in up to 17 different EVM chains. This powerful tool provides unprecedented visibility into the decentralized ecosystem, making it easier than ever to track and verify blockchain activities.

In essence, Blockscan is not just a search engine but a comprehensive explorer for the distributed web. By simplifying access and enhancing transparency, Blockscan is poised to become an indispensable tool for blockchain enthusiasts and newcomers alike. Explore the decentralized web with ease and confidence at [Blockscan](https://blockscan.com).

[Here is the twitter (X) annoucement](https://x.com/etherscan/status/1811413541938991609) 
<b/>
[Their website is here](https://blockscan.com/)

title: Exploring the Synergy of Crypto and E-Commerce: A New Era 1
description: Discover how cryptocurrency is revolutionizing e-commerce in article 1.

body.raw:
The intersection of cryptocurrency and e-commerce represents a thrilling frontier in digital commerce. In this 1th article of the series, we delve into how blockchain technology is transforming online shopping experiences.

Cryptocurrencies offer a new level of security, efficiency, and global reach in transactions, making them an increasingly popular choice in the e-commerce world. With their decentralized nature, cryptocurrencies ensure a more transparent and secure transaction process, free from traditional banking limitations.

<Image src="/crypto_ecommerce_1.jpg" width="400" height="275" alt="Crypto and E-Commerce" />

One key advantage of using crypto in e-commerce is the reduction in transaction fees. Traditional online payment systems often come with significant fees, especially for international transactions. Cryptocurrencies can drastically cut these costs, making online shopping more accessible and affordable for customers around the globe.

Moreover, the integration of smart contracts in e-commerce platforms ensures automated, error-free transactions. This technology, powered by blockchain, allows for seamless, trustworthy exchanges between buyers and sellers without the need for intermediaries.

As we move forward, it's evident that the synergy between cryptocurrency and e-commerce is not just a passing trend but a substantial shift in how we perceive and engage in online transactions. Stay tuned for more insights in our next article!

For more fascinating insights into the world of crypto and e-commerce, follow our series and explore how these technologies are shaping the future of online shopping.

title: Crypto Hack Shakes the Market
description: A $230 million hack rocks the cryptocurrency world, underscoring the urgent need for better security measures across DeFi platforms. This post covers the implications and reactions from the crypto community.

body.raw: üîç A shocking $230 million hack was recently caught on stream, shaking the crypto community [link](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2024/09/25/wazirx-hacker-is-almost-done-laundering-230m-stolen-funds/). The hack not only highlighted the vulnerabilities in decentralized platforms but also showcased the speed at which these attacks can occur. Onlookers witnessed the event unfold live, bringing attention to the need for enhanced security measures across DeFi platforms. As the market grows, incidents like this serve as stark reminders of the risks involved. The crypto industry must continue to evolve its security protocols to protect users and their investments.

title: Cryptocurrency Insights Navigating the Digital Economy
description: Deep dive into the latest trends and technologies in cryptocurrency

body.raw:
The world of cryptocurrency is ever-evolving, and in this 1th article, we explore the cutting-edge trends shaping the digital economy. Cryptocurrency, as a decentralized digital currency, has not only revolutionized the way we think about money but also how we interact with the global economy.

Blockchain, the underlying technology of cryptocurrencies, offers unparalleled security and transparency in transactions. This innovation has led to the development of new cryptocurrencies, each with unique features and potential.

One of the key aspects we'll discuss is the rise of decentralized finance (DeFi), which is changing the face of banking and financial services. DeFi platforms allow users to lend, borrow, and earn interest on their crypto assets without the need for traditional financial intermediaries.

We'll also look at the impact of cryptocurrencies on global remittances and how they are making cross-border transactions faster and more cost-effective. 

Stay tuned as we delve deeper into the fascinating world of cryptocurrencies and their impact on our digital future.

title: DeFi Integration and Cross-Chain Innovations
description: This post explores the latest advancements in decentralized finance (DeFi) and cross-chain technology, highlighting how projects like Solana and Sundog are pushing for better blockchain integration and staking opportunities.

body.raw:
üöÄ The decentralized finance (DeFi) space continues to evolve rapidly, with several exciting advancements in both integration and cross-chain technologies. Projects across the blockchain ecosystem are striving to enhance their functionality by creating more seamless interactions between various networks. These cross-chain innovations are crucial, as users demand more fluid transactions and liquidity across blockchains.

One of the standout examples of these efforts is Solana, which has made significant strides in blockchain technology with its **ZK compression** launch on the mainnet. This innovative approach to data compression allows for faster, more cost-effective transactions on the Solana network. With zero-knowledge (ZK) proofs, Solana aims to improve scalability while maintaining security, making it a top choice for developers seeking high-performance blockchain solutions.

In parallel, the rise of staking mechanisms continues to captivate the DeFi community. **Sundog** is one project that has caught attention due to its impressive staking options. With **annual percentage rates (APRs) as high as 60%**, Sundog is positioning itself as a key player in the staking arena, offering users lucrative opportunities to earn passive income. These high rewards, coupled with growing interest in meme tokens, have helped Sundog carve out a niche in the competitive DeFi landscape.

As the DeFi sector becomes increasingly interconnected, cross-chain technology plays a vital role. Users are no longer confined to one network for their transactions; instead, they seek better interoperability between blockchains. Projects like **Polkadot** and **Cosmos** have pioneered efforts in this space, enabling the transfer of assets and data across multiple blockchains without compromising on security.

While newer projects like Sundog and Solana continue to drive innovation, **Ethereum** and **Bitcoin** remain the dominant forces in the market. Bitcoin's ongoing appeal to institutional investors solidifies its status as the gold standard in digital assets, while Ethereum's smart contract functionality keeps it at the forefront of decentralized applications (dApps) development.

As we look to the future, the integration of cross-chain technologies and innovative DeFi solutions will be key drivers in shaping the blockchain industry. These advancements promise to improve user experience, expand DeFi opportunities, and create a more interconnected crypto ecosystem.

---

References:

- [Solana's ZK Compression Technology](https://solana.com/zk-compression)
- [Sundog Staking Opportunities](https://sundog.finance/staking)
- [Cross-Chain Innovation: Polkadot and Cosmos](https://polkadot.network/cross-chain-technology)

title: Deploying Next.js Apps
description: How to deploy your Next.js apps on Vercel.

body.raw:
Until now, trying to style an article, document, or blog post with Tailwind has been a tedious task that required a keen eye for typography and a lot of complex custom CSS. By default, Tailwind removes all of the default browser styling from paragraphs, headings, lists and more. This ends up being really useful for building application UIs because you spend less time undoing user-agent styles, but when you _really are_ just trying to style some content that came from a rich-text editor in a CMS or a markdown file, it can be surprising and unintuitive. We get lots of complaints about it actually, with people regularly asking us things like: > Why is Tailwind removing the default styles on my `h1` elements? How do I disable this? What do you mean I lose all the other base styles too? > We hear you, but we're not convinced that simply disabling our base styles is what you really want. You don't want to have to remove annoying margins every time you use a `p` element in a piece of your dashboard UI. And I doubt you really want your blog posts to use the user-agent styles either ‚Äî you want them to look _awesome_, not awful. The `@tailwindcss/typography` plugin is our attempt to give you what you _actually_ want, without any of the downsides of doing something stupid like disabling our base styles. It adds a new `prose` class that you can slap on any block of vanilla HTML content and turn it into a beautiful, well-formatted document: ```html

Garlic bread with cheese: What the science tells us

For years parents have espoused the health benefits of eating garlic bread with cheese to their children, with the food earning such an iconic status in our culture that kids will often dress up as warm, cheesy loaf for Halloween.

But a recent study shows that the celebrated appetizer may be linked to a series of rabies cases springing up around the country.

``` For more information about how to use the plugin and the features it includes, [read the documentation](https://github.com/tailwindcss/typography/blob/master/README.md). --- ## What to expect from here on out What follows from here is just a bunch of absolute nonsense I've written to dogfood the plugin itself. It includes every sensible typographic element I could think of, like **bold text**, unordered lists, ordered lists, code blocks, block quotes, _and even italics_. It's important to cover all of these use cases for a few reasons: 1. We want everything to look good out of the box. 2. Really just the first reason, that's the whole point of the plugin. 3. Here's a third pretend reason though a list with three items looks more realistic than a list with two items. Now we're going to try out another header style. ### Typography should be easy So that's a header for you ‚Äî with any luck if we've done our job correctly that will look pretty reasonable. Something a wise person once told me about typography is: > Typography is pretty important if you don't want your stuff to look like trash. Make it good then it won't be bad. It's probably important that images look okay here by default as well: Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old. Now I'm going to show you an example of an unordered list to make sure that looks good, too: - So here is the first item in this list. - In this example we're keeping the items short. - Later, we'll use longer, more complex list items. And that's the end of this section. ## What if we stack headings? ### We should make sure that looks good, too. Sometimes you have headings directly underneath each other. In those cases you often have to undo the top margin on the second heading because it usually looks better for the headings to be closer together than a paragraph followed by a heading should be. ### When a heading comes after a paragraph ‚Ä¶ When a heading comes after a paragraph, we need a bit more space, like I already mentioned above. Now let's see what a more complex list would look like. - **I often do this thing where list items have headings.** For some reason I think this looks cool which is unfortunate because it's pretty annoying to get the styles right. I often have two or three paragraphs in these list items, too, so the hard part is getting the spacing between the paragraphs, list item heading, and separate list items to all make sense. Pretty tough honestly, you could make a strong argument that you just shouldn't write this way. - **Since this is a list, I need at least two items.** I explained what I'm doing already in the previous list item, but a list wouldn't be a list if it only had one item, and we really want this to look realistic. That's why I've added this second list item so I actually have something to look at when writing the styles. - **It's not a bad idea to add a third item either.** I think it probably would've been fine to just use two items but three is definitely not worse, and since I seem to be having no trouble making up arbitrary things to type, I might as well include it. After this sort of list I usually have a closing statement or paragraph, because it kinda looks weird jumping right to a heading. ## Code should look okay by default. I think most people are going to use [highlight.js](https://highlightjs.org/) or [Prism](https://prismjs.com/) or something if they want to style their code blocks but it wouldn't hurt to make them look _okay_ out of the box, even with no syntax highlighting. Here's what a default `tailwind.config.js` file looks like at the time of writing: ```js module.exports = { purge: [], theme: { extend: {}, }, variants: {}, plugins: [], }; ``` Hopefully that looks good enough to you. ### What about nested lists? Nested lists basically always look bad which is why editors like Medium don't even let you do it, but I guess since some of you goofballs are going to do it we have to carry the burden of at least making it work. 1. **Nested lists are rarely a good idea.** - You might feel like you are being really "organized" or something but you are just creating a gross shape on the screen that is hard to read. - Nested navigation in UIs is a bad idea too, keep things as flat as possible. - Nesting tons of folders in your source code is also not helpful. 2. **Since we need to have more items, here's another one.** - I'm not sure if we'll bother styling more than two levels deep. - Two is already too much, three is guaranteed to be a bad idea. - If you nest four levels deep you belong in prison. 3. **Two items isn't really a list, three is good though.** - Again please don't nest lists if you want people to actually read your content. - Nobody wants to look at this. - I'm upset that we even have to bother styling this. The most annoying thing about lists in Markdown is that `
  • ` elements aren't given a child `

    ` tag unless there are multiple paragraphs in the list item. That means I have to worry about styling that annoying situation too. - **For example, here's another nested list.** But this time with a second paragraph. - These list items won't have `

    ` tags - Because they are only one line each - **But in this second top-level list item, they will.** This is especially annoying because of the spacing on this paragraph. - As you can see here, because I've added a second line, this list item now has a `

    ` tag. This is the second line I'm talking about by the way. - Finally here's another list item so it's more like a list. - A closing list item, but with no nested list, because why not? And finally a sentence to close off this section.

For years parents have espoused the health benefits of eating garlic bread with cheese to their children, with the food earning such an iconic status in our culture that kids will often dress up as warm, cheesy loaf for Halloween.

title: Dynamic Routing and Static Regeneration
description: How to use incremental static regeneration using dynamic routes.

body.raw:
Until now, trying to style an article, document, or blog post with Tailwind has been a tedious task that required a keen eye for typography and a lot of complex custom CSS. By default, Tailwind removes all of the default browser styling from paragraphs, headings, lists and more. This ends up being really useful for building application UIs because you spend less time undoing user-agent styles, but when you _really are_ just trying to style some content that came from a rich-text editor in a CMS or a markdown file, it can be surprising and unintuitive. We get lots of complaints about it actually, with people regularly asking us things like: > Why is Tailwind removing the default styles on my `h1` elements? How do I disable this? What do you mean I lose all the other base styles too? > We hear you, but we're not convinced that simply disabling our base styles is what you really want. You don't want to have to remove annoying margins every time you use a `p` element in a piece of your dashboard UI. And I doubt you really want your blog posts to use the user-agent styles either ‚Äî you want them to look _awesome_, not awful. The `@tailwindcss/typography` plugin is our attempt to give you what you _actually_ want, without any of the downsides of doing something stupid like disabling our base styles. It adds a new `prose` class that you can slap on any block of vanilla HTML content and turn it into a beautiful, well-formatted document: ```html

Garlic bread with cheese: What the science tells us

For years parents have espoused the health benefits of eating garlic bread with cheese to their children, with the food earning such an iconic status in our culture that kids will often dress up as warm, cheesy loaf for Halloween.

But a recent study shows that the celebrated appetizer may be linked to a series of rabies cases springing up around the country.

``` For more information about how to use the plugin and the features it includes, [read the documentation](https://github.com/tailwindcss/typography/blob/master/README.md). --- ## What to expect from here on out What follows from here is just a bunch of absolute nonsense I've written to dogfood the plugin itself. It includes every sensible typographic element I could think of, like **bold text**, unordered lists, ordered lists, code blocks, block quotes, _and even italics_. It's important to cover all of these use cases for a few reasons: 1. We want everything to look good out of the box. 2. Really just the first reason, that's the whole point of the plugin. 3. Here's a third pretend reason though a list with three items looks more realistic than a list with two items. Now we're going to try out another header style. ### Typography should be easy So that's a header for you ‚Äî with any luck if we've done our job correctly that will look pretty reasonable. Something a wise person once told me about typography is: > Typography is pretty important if you don't want your stuff to look like trash. Make it good then it won't be bad. It's probably important that images look okay here by default as well: Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old. Now I'm going to show you an example of an unordered list to make sure that looks good, too: - So here is the first item in this list. - In this example we're keeping the items short. - Later, we'll use longer, more complex list items. And that's the end of this section. ## What if we stack headings? ### We should make sure that looks good, too. Sometimes you have headings directly underneath each other. In those cases you often have to undo the top margin on the second heading because it usually looks better for the headings to be closer together than a paragraph followed by a heading should be. ### When a heading comes after a paragraph ‚Ä¶ When a heading comes after a paragraph, we need a bit more space, like I already mentioned above. Now let's see what a more complex list would look like. - **I often do this thing where list items have headings.** For some reason I think this looks cool which is unfortunate because it's pretty annoying to get the styles right. I often have two or three paragraphs in these list items, too, so the hard part is getting the spacing between the paragraphs, list item heading, and separate list items to all make sense. Pretty tough honestly, you could make a strong argument that you just shouldn't write this way. - **Since this is a list, I need at least two items.** I explained what I'm doing already in the previous list item, but a list wouldn't be a list if it only had one item, and we really want this to look realistic. That's why I've added this second list item so I actually have something to look at when writing the styles. - **It's not a bad idea to add a third item either.** I think it probably would've been fine to just use two items but three is definitely not worse, and since I seem to be having no trouble making up arbitrary things to type, I might as well include it. After this sort of list I usually have a closing statement or paragraph, because it kinda looks weird jumping right to a heading. ## Code should look okay by default. I think most people are going to use [highlight.js](https://highlightjs.org/) or [Prism](https://prismjs.com/) or something if they want to style their code blocks but it wouldn't hurt to make them look _okay_ out of the box, even with no syntax highlighting. Here's what a default `tailwind.config.js` file looks like at the time of writing: ```js module.exports = { purge: [], theme: { extend: {}, }, variants: {}, plugins: [], }; ``` Hopefully that looks good enough to you. ### What about nested lists? Nested lists basically always look bad which is why editors like Medium don't even let you do it, but I guess since some of you goofballs are going to do it we have to carry the burden of at least making it work. 1. **Nested lists are rarely a good idea.** - You might feel like you are being really "organized" or something but you are just creating a gross shape on the screen that is hard to read. - Nested navigation in UIs is a bad idea too, keep things as flat as possible. - Nesting tons of folders in your source code is also not helpful. 2. **Since we need to have more items, here's another one.** - I'm not sure if we'll bother styling more than two levels deep. - Two is already too much, three is guaranteed to be a bad idea. - If you nest four levels deep you belong in prison. 3. **Two items isn't really a list, three is good though.** - Again please don't nest lists if you want people to actually read your content. - Nobody wants to look at this. - I'm upset that we even have to bother styling this. The most annoying thing about lists in Markdown is that `
  • ` elements aren't given a child `

    ` tag unless there are multiple paragraphs in the list item. That means I have to worry about styling that annoying situation too. - **For example, here's another nested list.** But this time with a second paragraph. - These list items won't have `

    ` tags - Because they are only one line each - **But in this second top-level list item, they will.** This is especially annoying because of the spacing on this paragraph. - As you can see here, because I've added a second line, this list item now has a `

    ` tag. This is the second line I'm talking about by the way. - Finally here's another list item so it's more like a list. - A closing list item, but with no nested list, because why not? And finally a sentence to close off this section.

Garlic bread with cheese: What the science tells us

For years parents have espoused the health benefits of eating garlic bread with cheese to their children, with the food earning such an iconic status in our culture that kids will often dress up as warm, cheesy loaf for Halloween.

But a recent study shows that the celebrated appetizer may be linked to a series of rabies cases springing up around the country.

title: Hamster Kombat Token Airdrop and TGE Boost Community Engagement
description: Hamster Kombat conducts its Token Generation Event and airdrop, generating buzz within the community.

body.raw:
Hamster Kombat attracted significant attention with its Token Generation Event (TGE) and airdrop on September 26, 2024. The airdrop was well-received, and community engagement surged, positioning the project for further growth in the blockchain gaming sector. But the launch didnt go exactly as planned. [link](https://cointelegraph.com/news/hamster-kombat-token-price-plunges-exchange-debut)
Since the launch, the price plumeted from 0.012 to the current price of 0.006814 [link](https://cointelegraph.com/news/hamster-kombat-token-price-plunges-exchange-debut)

title: Key Developments to Watch
description: Explore the recent trends in the cryptocurrency landscape for October 2024, focusing on market shifts, blockchain upgrades, and the rise of adoption globally.

body.raw:
üöÄ **Crypto Tech Insights: October 2024 Highlights** October has been a pivotal month in the cryptocurrency space, with significant developments across markets, institutions, and decentralized finance (DeFi). Here's a look at the most important trends and updates shaping the landscape this month.
### üìà Bitcoin's Market Outlook: Will "Uptober" Deliver Again? Bitcoin is once again in the spotlight, with analysts debating whether the cryptocurrency can continue its trend of outperforming in October‚Äîoften referred to as "Uptober" by traders. Key drivers include institutional adoption and bitcoin's fixed supply, particularly after the April 2024 halving, which reduced the block reward to 3.125 BTC. Analysts believe this scarcity, combined with growing demand from institutional investors, could push Bitcoin beyond the $65,200 resistance level, potentially reaching new highs [source](https://crypto-news-flash.com). However, geopolitical tensions and macroeconomic factors remain influential, creating uncertainty in the market.
### üîó Blockchain Upgrades and DeFi Growth This month also saw major blockchain upgrades, notably in the **Avalanche** and **Polkadot** ecosystems. Avalanche's impressive 20.1% surge was driven by its Avalanche9000 upgrade and a $40 million developer grant, making it one of the fastest-growing platforms. Meanwhile, Polkadot‚Äôs interoperability, enabling communication between major networks like Ethereum and Bitcoin, continues to capture the attention of developers [source](https://binance.com). In the DeFi space, **Sui** and **Base** have shown significant growth in Total Value Locked (TVL), with Base's TVL climbing by 44.6%. These advancements are crucial as they enhance liquidity in decentralized exchanges, lending platforms, and other DeFi solutions [source](https://binance.com).
### üåç Global Adoption on the Rise Global adoption of cryptocurrency has surged in 2024, with more than 560 million people now owning some form of crypto. This 33% year-over-year growth has been fueled by increased retail and institutional use, particularly in emerging markets like Sub-Saharan Africa and Latin America. Stablecoins, in particular, have seen rapid adoption as a cost-effective tool for cross-border payments and remittances [source](https://marketscreener.com). As Q4 progresses, the crypto world continues to evolve, with these trends shaping the future of both traditional and decentralized finance.

title: Microsoft‚Äôs Shareholders to Vote on Bitcoin Investment: A New Era for Corporate Crypto?
description: With Microsoft‚Äôs shareholders voting on a Bitcoin investment proposal, we explore the potential implications and what this could mean for corporate crypto adoption in 2024 and beyond.

body.raw:
üö® **Microsoft Shareholders to Vote on Bitcoin Investment Proposal: What It Means for the Future of Corporate Crypto** In a groundbreaking move, Microsoft, the third-largest company in the world by market cap, has announced a shareholder vote on a proposal to invest in **Bitcoin**. This decision could signal a major shift toward broader corporate adoption of cryptocurrency and bring significant changes to both Microsoft‚Äôs asset portfolio and the global crypto market.
### üè¢ **Why This Matters for Microsoft and Its Investors** The vote on Bitcoin investment is a significant step, as it reflects the growing institutional interest in digital assets. Microsoft‚Äôs decision to consider Bitcoin may be influenced by several factors: 1. **Hedge Against Inflation**: With global economic uncertainties, many institutional investors are turning to Bitcoin as a hedge against inflation. As a decentralized asset with a fixed supply, Bitcoin is seen as ‚Äúdigital gold‚Äù by those seeking to preserve value over time. 2. **Diversification of Microsoft‚Äôs Portfolio**: If approved, Bitcoin investment would diversify Microsoft‚Äôs holdings, adding digital assets to its traditionally tech-heavy portfolio. This move mirrors those of companies like **Tesla** and **MicroStrategy**, which have allocated portions of their reserves to Bitcoin. 3. **Strategic Long-Term Growth**: As a tech giant, Microsoft could benefit strategically from early positioning in digital assets, especially if it uses Bitcoin and blockchain technology to explore new products or services. Integrating Bitcoin with Microsoft‚Äôs existing infrastructure could open doors to blockchain innovation, potentially enhancing offerings like Azure, Microsoft‚Äôs cloud platform. ### üí° **What This Means for Corporate Crypto Adoption** If the proposal passes, Microsoft would be one of the largest publicly traded companies to invest in Bitcoin, setting a new benchmark for corporate crypto adoption. This could have far-reaching implications for how other corporations view digital assets. Here‚Äôs how: #### 1. **Validation for Bitcoin and Cryptocurrencies** Corporate endorsements have a history of legitimizing emerging technologies. If Microsoft decides to invest in Bitcoin, it could drive other Fortune 500 companies to reconsider digital assets as part of their financial strategy. In recent years, institutions like **BlackRock** and **Fidelity** have expanded their crypto portfolios, and Microsoft‚Äôs involvement could spur even more corporate interest. #### 2. **Market Stability and Institutional Trust** As major institutions adopt Bitcoin, volatility tends to decrease as large-scale purchases add liquidity to the market. Microsoft‚Äôs potential investment would add to this stability, fostering an environment of increased trust among investors, consumers, and governments. When more companies add Bitcoin to their holdings, the perceived legitimacy of cryptocurrency as an asset class strengthens, possibly encouraging regulatory clarity and guidelines.
### üöÄ **What‚Äôs at Stake for the Crypto Market** Bitcoin‚Äôs value and broader cryptocurrency sentiment could see a significant impact from Microsoft‚Äôs vote, potentially leading to price appreciation and a stronger bull market. Historically, announcements of corporate involvement in Bitcoin have had immediate effects on price and investor sentiment. For example, **Tesla‚Äôs Bitcoin acquisition** in early 2021 led to a substantial rally across the crypto market. If Microsoft moves forward, its adoption might signal a major trend shift, possibly ushering in more large-scale corporate investments. The implications extend to: 1. **Increased Demand**: A vote in favor of Bitcoin investment would likely increase demand, particularly if other corporations decide to follow suit. With only 21 million Bitcoin ever to exist, this demand could contribute to scarcity, which could drive value. 2. **Positive Sentiment in the Crypto Space**: Microsoft‚Äôs potential vote has already generated excitement, and a successful vote could drive widespread positive sentiment, as crypto advocates see institutional adoption as a sign of maturation and stability in the market. 3. **Future Product Integration Possibilities**: Microsoft‚Äôs blockchain team could explore Bitcoin integrations into products like Azure, Dynamics 365, and even Office. These possibilities could open the door to enterprise blockchain services, adding value for businesses that operate on Microsoft platforms. ### üîÆ **Potential Risks and Considerations** While the possibility of a Bitcoin investment by Microsoft is exciting, it‚Äôs essential to consider the risks: - **Regulatory Scrutiny**: Given that Bitcoin investments by major corporations can attract regulatory attention, Microsoft could face heightened scrutiny over compliance with existing and future regulations. - **Market Volatility**: Although Bitcoin has shown significant returns, it is still subject to high volatility. Microsoft‚Äôs involvement might help mitigate this over time, but it remains a consideration. - **Shareholder Opposition**: Some shareholders may see Bitcoin as too risky for Microsoft‚Äôs balance sheet and could push back against the proposal. This decision will ultimately hinge on whether shareholders see the long-term benefits outweighing the risks.
### üåê **The Road Ahead** Whether Microsoft‚Äôs shareholders vote to invest in Bitcoin or not, this decision alone marks a pivotal moment for the tech industry and the cryptocurrency market. As more corporations contemplate adding digital assets to their balance sheets, the broader implications for financial markets, technology innovation, and regulatory frameworks will become increasingly important. This vote represents more than just a potential investment in cryptocurrency; it reflects a changing perspective on digital assets and their role in the future of finance. As we await the results, all eyes are on Microsoft, and by extension, the global corporate world, as they navigate this landmark decision. --- Microsoft‚Äôs move is a critical moment for corporate crypto adoption, with the potential to set a new standard for how major companies engage with digital assets. Keep an eye out for the results of this vote, as it could be a catalyst for future corporate investments in cryptocurrency. **Sources:** - [Blockchain Magazine](https://blockchainmagazine.com) on corporate adoption trends. - [Techopedia](https://techopedia.com) on institutional crypto investments. - [Blockchain Council](https://blockchain-council.org) on implications of corporate Bitcoin investments.

title: October 2024 Crypto Tech Update: Key Trends and Insights
description: Explore the latest trends and updates in the cryptocurrency space for October 2024, including blockchain advancements, market shifts, and regulatory changes.

body.raw:
üöÄ **Crypto Tech News October 2024: Major Developments You Should Know** October 2024 is packed with exciting developments in the crypto world, from promising altcoin growth to major blockchain upgrades and critical market shifts.
### üìà BlockDAG and Solana Lead Altcoin Growth **BlockDAG** has emerged as one of the top-performing cryptos this month, attracting investor attention with its record-breaking presale and immense community support. It has the potential to reshape the blockchain space with its unique DAG architecture, positioning it as a contender for massive future growth. Meanwhile, **Solana** continues its climb, with scalability improvements and partnerships with major financial institutions like Citibank boosting its appeal [source](https://crypto-news-flash.com).
### üíº Regulatory Shifts and Market Reactions On the regulatory front, the cryptocurrency space is still grappling with fallout from SEC actions, particularly surrounding **Ripple's XRP** case. This has caused market volatility, especially as the SEC appeals recent decisions that could affect how cryptocurrencies are classified in the future [source](https://dailycoin.com). Despite this uncertainty, major tokens like Bitcoin have shown resilience, driven by optimism around the US Federal Reserve‚Äôs interest rate cuts [source](https://binance.com).
### üîó Blockchain Upgrades Fuel Innovation Blockchain networks like **Avalanche** and **Polkadot** are making strides with upgrades aimed at increasing scalability and improving transaction speeds. **Avalanche**‚Äôs ecosystem has thrived following its latest network upgrades, boasting fast transactions and low fees, making it an attractive option for developers seeking Ethereum compatibility [source](https://crypto-news-flash.com). Similarly, **Polkadot** continues to lead in blockchain interoperability with its parachain technology, allowing seamless communication between multiple blockchains [source](https://binance.com).
### üìÖ DeFi and NFT Markets: Key Updates DeFi projects like **Sui** and **Base** have seen significant growth in their Total Value Locked (TVL), with **Sui** benefiting from new stablecoin integrations and the release of its gaming ecosystem. **Base** surpassed $2.2 billion in TVL this month, reflecting the ongoing expansion in the decentralized finance sector [source](https://binance.com). Meanwhile, the NFT market continues to face challenges, with trading volumes down by over 20%, signaling reduced interest in digital collectibles for now [source](https://binance.com). Stay updated on these key trends as we move forward into Q4 2024, a time expected to bring even more developments across the crypto landscape.

title: New 1inch product
description: 1inch introduces Fusion+, a cross-chain swap feature designed to protect users from MEV attacks. This post dives into the security improvements and versatility that cross-chain technology brings to DeFi enthusiasts.

body.raw: üöÄ Decentralized finance continues to innovate, and 1inch has introduced a new cross-chain swap feature called 'Fusion+'. This tool will allow users to seamlessly swap assets across different blockchains, offering protection against MEV (miner extractable value) attacks. Cross-chain technology is becoming increasingly important as users seek more flexibility in managing their digital assets without being locked into a single blockchain. As projects like 1inch continue to innovate, we're seeing the DeFi ecosystem expand rapidly, bringing more security and versatility to users.

title: Revolutionary Photonic Computing Method Solves Complex Equations at Light Speed!
description: Discover how scientists are using photonic computing and electromagnetic waves to rapidly solve partial differential equations, a breakthrough that could change physics and engineering forever.

body.raw:
üåü **Breakthrough in Photonic Computing: Solving PDEs at Light Speed** Scientists at Newcastle University have introduced an innovative **photonic computing** method that uses **electromagnetic (EM) waves** to solve partial differential equations (PDEs) like the **Helmholtz wave equation** with unprecedented speed. This groundbreaking technique leverages **metatronic networks**‚Äîwaveguides filled with dielectric inserts‚Äîthat mimic traditional circuit elements.
### üí° How It Works The key innovation lies in these waveguide-based networks, which control PDE parameters by adjusting the size and permittivity of the dielectric inserts. This allows for solving complex boundary problems like EM wave scattering and light focusing. ### üîç Why It Matters This photonic approach is a game-changer for industries that rely heavily on PDEs, from **physics** to **engineering**. It accelerates computing processes and offers **approximate solutions** far faster than traditional numerical methods. While this photonic breakthrough has the potential to revolutionize fields like **physics**, **engineering**, and **materials science**, its implications for **cryptographic security** cannot be ignored. Traditional cryptographic systems, like those that secure **cryptocurrency wallets** today, rely on mathematical complexity and time-intensive computations to protect sensitive data. Current cryptographic algorithms, such as **RSA** and **ECC (Elliptic Curve Cryptography)**, are based on problems that classical computers find hard to solve quickly. However, **photonic computing** operates at the speed of light, and its ability to solve complex equations rapidly could present a significant challenge to these cryptographic systems in the future. This technology, while still in its early stages, demonstrates the potential to process mathematical problems exponentially faster than current classical or even quantum computers. Over time, this speed could be leveraged to break encryption methods that are foundational to today‚Äôs **blockchain** and **digital wallets**.
Before panic ensues, it‚Äôs crucial to stress that **current cryptographic systems remain safe** for the time being. The development and deployment of photonic computing capable of undermining cryptographic algorithms is still a long way off. However, this future prospect emphasizes the need for **next-generation cryptographic algorithms**‚Äîsuch as **post-quantum cryptography**‚Äîwhich aim to withstand both quantum and photonic computing attacks. Without advancements in cryptographic techniques, systems that protect our most sensitive assets, like **Bitcoin wallets** or **Ethereum private keys**, could be at risk once technologies like **photonic computing** mature. The research highlights a possible arms race between **computing power** and **cryptography**, where the ability to solve complex problems at light speed must be met with equally advanced encryption techniques that can safeguard digital assets in a post-photonic world. Fortunately, researchers in cryptography are already aware of these looming threats and are working on **post-quantum cryptographic standards** that could serve as a defense against future computing technologies. These include algorithms that resist attack vectors possible in **quantum** or **photonic** computing environments, ensuring that our digital transactions and assets remain secure.
Stay tuned as this photonic technology continues to reshape how we approach complex calculations! [source](https://phys.org/news/2024-10-photonic-method-electromagnetic-rapidly-partial.html#google_vignette)

title: Preview Mode for Headless CMS
description: How to implement preview mode in your headless CMS.

body.raw:
Until now, trying to style an article, document, or blog post with Tailwind has been a tedious task that required a keen eye for typography and a lot of complex custom CSS. By default, Tailwind removes all of the default browser styling from paragraphs, headings, lists and more. This ends up being really useful for building application UIs because you spend less time undoing user-agent styles, but when you _really are_ just trying to style some content that came from a rich-text editor in a CMS or a markdown file, it can be surprising and unintuitive. We get lots of complaints about it actually, with people regularly asking us things like: > Why is Tailwind removing the default styles on my `h1` elements? How do I disable this? What do you mean I lose all the other base styles too? > We hear you, but we're not convinced that simply disabling our base styles is what you really want. You don't want to have to remove annoying margins every time you use a `p` element in a piece of your dashboard UI. And I doubt you really want your blog posts to use the user-agent styles either ‚Äî you want them to look _awesome_, not awful. The `@tailwindcss/typography` plugin is our attempt to give you what you _actually_ want, without any of the downsides of doing something stupid like disabling our base styles. It adds a new `prose` class that you can slap on any block of vanilla HTML content and turn it into a beautiful, well-formatted document: ```html

Garlic bread with cheese: What the science tells us

For years parents have espoused the health benefits of eating garlic bread with cheese to their children, with the food earning such an iconic status in our culture that kids will often dress up as warm, cheesy loaf for Halloween.

But a recent study shows that the celebrated appetizer may be linked to a series of rabies cases springing up around the country.

``` For more information about how to use the plugin and the features it includes, [read the documentation](https://github.com/tailwindcss/typography/blob/master/README.md). --- ## What to expect from here on out What follows from here is just a bunch of absolute nonsense I've written to dogfood the plugin itself. It includes every sensible typographic element I could think of, like **bold text**, unordered lists, ordered lists, code blocks, block quotes, _and even italics_. It's important to cover all of these use cases for a few reasons: 1. We want everything to look good out of the box. 2. Really just the first reason, that's the whole point of the plugin. 3. Here's a third pretend reason though a list with three items looks more realistic than a list with two items. Now we're going to try out another header style. ### Typography should be easy So that's a header for you ‚Äî with any luck if we've done our job correctly that will look pretty reasonable. Something a wise person once told me about typography is: > Typography is pretty important if you don't want your stuff to look like trash. Make it good then it won't be bad. It's probably important that images look okay here by default as well: Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old. Now I'm going to show you an example of an unordered list to make sure that looks good, too: - So here is the first item in this list. - In this example we're keeping the items short. - Later, we'll use longer, more complex list items. And that's the end of this section. ## What if we stack headings? ### We should make sure that looks good, too. Sometimes you have headings directly underneath each other. In those cases you often have to undo the top margin on the second heading because it usually looks better for the headings to be closer together than a paragraph followed by a heading should be. ### When a heading comes after a paragraph ‚Ä¶ When a heading comes after a paragraph, we need a bit more space, like I already mentioned above. Now let's see what a more complex list would look like. - **I often do this thing where list items have headings.** For some reason I think this looks cool which is unfortunate because it's pretty annoying to get the styles right. I often have two or three paragraphs in these list items, too, so the hard part is getting the spacing between the paragraphs, list item heading, and separate list items to all make sense. Pretty tough honestly, you could make a strong argument that you just shouldn't write this way. - **Since this is a list, I need at least two items.** I explained what I'm doing already in the previous list item, but a list wouldn't be a list if it only had one item, and we really want this to look realistic. That's why I've added this second list item so I actually have something to look at when writing the styles. - **It's not a bad idea to add a third item either.** I think it probably would've been fine to just use two items but three is definitely not worse, and since I seem to be having no trouble making up arbitrary things to type, I might as well include it. After this sort of list I usually have a closing statement or paragraph, because it kinda looks weird jumping right to a heading. ## Code should look okay by default. I think most people are going to use [highlight.js](https://highlightjs.org/) or [Prism](https://prismjs.com/) or something if they want to style their code blocks but it wouldn't hurt to make them look _okay_ out of the box, even with no syntax highlighting. Here's what a default `tailwind.config.js` file looks like at the time of writing: ```js module.exports = { purge: [], theme: { extend: {}, }, variants: {}, plugins: [], }; ``` Hopefully that looks good enough to you. ### What about nested lists? Nested lists basically always look bad which is why editors like Medium don't even let you do it, but I guess since some of you goofballs are going to do it we have to carry the burden of at least making it work. 1. **Nested lists are rarely a good idea.** - You might feel like you are being really "organized" or something but you are just creating a gross shape on the screen that is hard to read. - Nested navigation in UIs is a bad idea too, keep things as flat as possible. - Nesting tons of folders in your source code is also not helpful. 2. **Since we need to have more items, here's another one.** - I'm not sure if we'll bother styling more than two levels deep. - Two is already too much, three is guaranteed to be a bad idea. - If you nest four levels deep you belong in prison. 3. **Two items isn't really a list, three is good though.** - Again please don't nest lists if you want people to actually read your content. - Nobody wants to look at this. - I'm upset that we even have to bother styling this. The most annoying thing about lists in Markdown is that `
  • ` elements aren't given a child `

    ` tag unless there are multiple paragraphs in the list item. That means I have to worry about styling that annoying situation too. - **For example, here's another nested list.** But this time with a second paragraph. - These list items won't have `

    ` tags - Because they are only one line each - **But in this second top-level list item, they will.** This is especially annoying because of the spacing on this paragraph. - As you can see here, because I've added a second line, this list item now has a `

    ` tag. This is the second line I'm talking about by the way. - Finally here's another list item so it's more like a list. - A closing list item, but with no nested list, because why not? And finally a sentence to close off this section.

Garlic bread with cheese: What the science tells us

For years parents have espoused the health benefits of eating garlic bread with cheese to their children, with the food earning such an iconic status in our culture that kids will often dress up as warm, cheesy loaf for Halloween.

But a recent study shows that the celebrated appetizer may be linked to a series of rabies cases springing up around the country.

title: Revolut Joins the Stablecoin Race
description: Revolut is developing its own stablecoin. What does this mean for the stablecoin market?

body.raw:
üì∞ Revolut [link](https://www.revolut.com/en-US/), a major fintech company, has thrown its hat into the stablecoin ring, signaling its intent to 
        compete with established players in the market. As cryptocurrencies become more mainstream, the demand for stable, 
        reliable digital assets has never been higher. Revolut aims to develop a fully compliant stablecoin to integrate with 
        its existing suite of financial services.

        Stablecoins, typically pegged to traditional currencies like the U.S. dollar, offer users the ability to trade and 
        transact in the cryptocurrency market without the volatility that characterizes other digital assets. The entrance of 
        Revolut into this market could be a game-changer, particularly as the company already boasts millions of users globally.

        Revolut‚Äôs foray into stablecoins is part of a broader trend where fintech companies are increasingly exploring 
        blockchain technology to offer more transparent and efficient financial services. Compliance will be a key focus for 
        Revolut, especially as regulators around the world are scrutinizing stablecoins more closely due to their potential 
        impact on monetary policies.

        The move not only reinforces Revolut‚Äôs commitment to staying at the forefront of financial innovation but also signals 
        the growing importance of stablecoins in the cryptocurrency ecosystem. As more companies like Revolut enter this space, 
        the competition to create the most secure and efficient stablecoin will intensify, ultimately benefiting the end users 
        who rely on these assets for stability and everyday transactions.

title: Blockchain Updates: September 2024
description: This blog post highlights some of the major tech-related events in the crypto world for September 2024, from blockchain upgrades to regulatory changes and market trends.

body.raw:
üöÄ **Crypto Tech News September 2024: Key Developments**

September 2024 has proven to be an exciting month for the crypto world, especially with several major events and upgrades taking place across different blockchain platforms. Here are some of the top updates from this month: ### üõ† Major Blockchain Upgrades Several blockchain networks, including Flow, Polkastarter, and Dusk Network, underwent significant upgrades this month. Notably, on **September 4**, Flow completed its *Crescendo Network* upgrade, designed to boost its scalability and attract developers to its ecosystem. Polkastarter also launched its *V4* version, enhancing its platform's features and attracting more project developers [source](https://blockchainreporter.net). Meanwhile, Dusk Network celebrated the launch of its mainnet on **September 20**, a crucial step towards decentralization.

Image credit: https://flow.com/core-protocol

### üíº Regulatory Movements The regulatory landscape in the crypto space also saw some important developments. On **September 12**, the SEC settled a case with **eToro USA**, resulting in a $1.5 million penalty for offering unregistered crypto asset securities. As part of the agreement, eToro will limit the crypto assets available to US customers, including Bitcoin, Ether, and Bitcoin Cash [source](https://dlapiper.com). The **CFTC** also issued charges against **Uniswap Labs** for illegal digital asset derivatives trading, resulting in a $175,000 penalty.

### üìà Market Trends & Predictions Despite some bearish movements earlier in the month, **Bitcoin** rebounded to around $58.4K, showing signs of recovery after a period of fear in the market. Analysts predict that the crypto space could experience a bullish run in Q4 2024, especially as institutions begin ramping up investments. This surge is likely to coincide with potential interest rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve [source](https://coinspeaker.com). Stay tuned as we continue to monitor these exciting developments and how they shape the future of the crypto industry.

title: Server and Client Components
description: React Server Components allow developers to build applications that span the server and client.

body.raw:
Until now, trying to style an article, document, or blog post with Tailwind has been a tedious task that required a keen eye for typography and a lot of complex custom CSS. By default, Tailwind removes all of the default browser styling from paragraphs, headings, lists and more. This ends up being really useful for building application UIs because you spend less time undoing user-agent styles, but when you _really are_ just trying to style some content that came from a rich-text editor in a CMS or a markdown file, it can be surprising and unintuitive. We get lots of complaints about it actually, with people regularly asking us things like: > Why is Tailwind removing the default styles on my `h1` elements? How do I disable this? What do you mean I lose all the other base styles too? > We hear you, but we're not convinced that simply disabling our base styles is what you really want. You don't want to have to remove annoying margins every time you use a `p` element in a piece of your dashboard UI. And I doubt you really want your blog posts to use the user-agent styles either ‚Äî you want them to look _awesome_, not awful. The `@tailwindcss/typography` plugin is our attempt to give you what you _actually_ want, without any of the downsides of doing something stupid like disabling our base styles. It adds a new `prose` class that you can slap on any block of vanilla HTML content and turn it into a beautiful, well-formatted document: ```html

Garlic bread with cheese: What the science tells us

For years parents have espoused the health benefits of eating garlic bread with cheese to their children, with the food earning such an iconic status in our culture that kids will often dress up as warm, cheesy loaf for Halloween.

But a recent study shows that the celebrated appetizer may be linked to a series of rabies cases springing up around the country.

``` For more information about how to use the plugin and the features it includes, [read the documentation](https://github.com/tailwindcss/typography/blob/master/README.md). --- ## What to expect from here on out What follows from here is just a bunch of absolute nonsense I've written to dogfood the plugin itself. It includes every sensible typographic element I could think of, like **bold text**, unordered lists, ordered lists, code blocks, block quotes, _and even italics_. It's important to cover all of these use cases for a few reasons: 1. We want everything to look good out of the box. 2. Really just the first reason, that's the whole point of the plugin. 3. Here's a third pretend reason though a list with three items looks more realistic than a list with two items. Now we're going to try out another header style. ### Typography should be easy So that's a header for you ‚Äî with any luck if we've done our job correctly that will look pretty reasonable. Something a wise person once told me about typography is: > Typography is pretty important if you don't want your stuff to look like trash. Make it good then it won't be bad. It's probably important that images look okay here by default as well: Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old. Now I'm going to show you an example of an unordered list to make sure that looks good, too: - So here is the first item in this list. - In this example we're keeping the items short. - Later, we'll use longer, more complex list items. And that's the end of this section. ## What if we stack headings? ### We should make sure that looks good, too. Sometimes you have headings directly underneath each other. In those cases you often have to undo the top margin on the second heading because it usually looks better for the headings to be closer together than a paragraph followed by a heading should be. ### When a heading comes after a paragraph ‚Ä¶ When a heading comes after a paragraph, we need a bit more space, like I already mentioned above. Now let's see what a more complex list would look like. - **I often do this thing where list items have headings.** For some reason I think this looks cool which is unfortunate because it's pretty annoying to get the styles right. I often have two or three paragraphs in these list items, too, so the hard part is getting the spacing between the paragraphs, list item heading, and separate list items to all make sense. Pretty tough honestly, you could make a strong argument that you just shouldn't write this way. - **Since this is a list, I need at least two items.** I explained what I'm doing already in the previous list item, but a list wouldn't be a list if it only had one item, and we really want this to look realistic. That's why I've added this second list item so I actually have something to look at when writing the styles. - **It's not a bad idea to add a third item either.** I think it probably would've been fine to just use two items but three is definitely not worse, and since I seem to be having no trouble making up arbitrary things to type, I might as well include it. After this sort of list I usually have a closing statement or paragraph, because it kinda looks weird jumping right to a heading. ## Code should look okay by default. I think most people are going to use [highlight.js](https://highlightjs.org/) or [Prism](https://prismjs.com/) or something if they want to style their code blocks but it wouldn't hurt to make them look _okay_ out of the box, even with no syntax highlighting. Here's what a default `tailwind.config.js` file looks like at the time of writing: ```js module.exports = { purge: [], theme: { extend: {}, }, variants: {}, plugins: [], }; ``` Hopefully that looks good enough to you. ### What about nested lists? Nested lists basically always look bad which is why editors like Medium don't even let you do it, but I guess since some of you goofballs are going to do it we have to carry the burden of at least making it work. 1. **Nested lists are rarely a good idea.** - You might feel like you are being really "organized" or something but you are just creating a gross shape on the screen that is hard to read. - Nested navigation in UIs is a bad idea too, keep things as flat as possible. - Nesting tons of folders in your source code is also not helpful. 2. **Since we need to have more items, here's another one.** - I'm not sure if we'll bother styling more than two levels deep. - Two is already too much, three is guaranteed to be a bad idea. - If you nest four levels deep you belong in prison. 3. **Two items isn't really a list, three is good though.** - Again please don't nest lists if you want people to actually read your content. - Nobody wants to look at this. - I'm upset that we even have to bother styling this. The most annoying thing about lists in Markdown is that `
  • ` elements aren't given a child `

    ` tag unless there are multiple paragraphs in the list item. That means I have to worry about styling that annoying situation too. - **For example, here's another nested list.** But this time with a second paragraph. - These list items won't have `

    ` tags - Because they are only one line each - **But in this second top-level list item, they will.** This is especially annoying because of the spacing on this paragraph. - As you can see here, because I've added a second line, this list item now has a `

    ` tag. This is the second line I'm talking about by the way. - Finally here's another list item so it's more like a list. - A closing list item, but with no nested list, because why not? And finally a sentence to close off this section.

Garlic bread with cheese: What the science tells us

For years parents have espoused the health benefits of eating garlic bread with cheese to their children, with the food earning such an iconic status in our culture that kids will often dress up as warm, cheesy loaf for Halloween.

But a recent study shows that the celebrated appetizer may be linked to a series of rabies cases springing up around the country.

title: Solana Network Insights: Major Developments and Innovations
description: Discover the latest updates in the Solana Network for October 2024, from ecosystem growth to technological advancements and institutional adoption.

body.raw:
üöÄ **Solana Network October 2024: Major Developments and Innovations** As we move into the final quarter of 2024, the Solana network continues to showcase its resilience and innovation. With a sharp increase in network activity, multiple partnerships, and technological upgrades, Solana is positioning itself as a leader in the blockchain world.
### üåê Institutional Adoption and DeFi Growth One of the key highlights of Solana‚Äôs recent growth is the increasing institutional interest. Major financial institutions like **Franklin Templeton** are launching significant projects on Solana, including a money market fund, while **Soci√©t√© G√©n√©rale** has introduced Euro CV, the first MiCA-compliant stablecoin issued by a bank on Solana. This level of institutional confidence underscores the robustness and scalability of the Solana network [source](https://solanacompass.com). In the DeFi space, **Kamino Finance** has emerged as a key player, providing liquidity solutions with a Total Value Locked (TVL) exceeding $240 million. Additionally, **Marinade Finance** continues to dominate liquid staking on Solana, with over $1 billion in assets staked across its platform, offering high yields through its mSOL tokens [source](https://coingecko.com).
### üîß Technological Advancements and Ecosystem Growth Solana‚Äôs continuous drive to improve its infrastructure is evident in the introduction of **Fire Dancer**, which is achieving over 80,000 transactions per second (TPS) on the testnet. This innovation, alongside **ZK Compression**‚Äîwhich reduces state costs by over 1000x‚Äîcements Solana's reputation as one of the most efficient and scalable blockchain networks in the world [source](https://solanacompass.com). The **Radar Hackathon**, a key event driving developer engagement, has attracted global participation with over $600 million in funding potential. Programs like the **Solana Labs Incubator** and **Super Team Earn** continue to nurture the developer community, ensuring the ecosystem thrives with new ideas and talent [source](https://solanacompass.com).
### üìà SOL Price Rally and Market Performance Driven by increased network activity, Solana's native token **SOL** has seen a resurgence, with projections that it may break through the $180 mark in the coming weeks. This price surge is fueled by both institutional inflows and the growing adoption of **memecoins** built on the Solana network, which have contributed to heightened user engagement [source](https://cointelegraph.com). As we approach the end of 2024, Solana's ecosystem continues to expand, with new projects, technological innovations, and significant institutional backing all contributing to its success. The future for Solana looks bright, with plenty of room for further growth and innovation.

title: The Evolution of ERC-404
description: Embracing Bright Horizons in the Crypto World and the Rise of RH404 on PulseChain

body.raw:
# Bright Horizons: The Evolution of ERC-404 and the Rise of RH404 on PulseChain

## Embracing Change in the Crypto World

As we navigate through the dynamic world of cryptocurrency, it's exciting to witness the evolution of the ERC-404 token standard. Despite a recent dip in prices, the potential for growth and innovation remains strong, and the advent of RH404 on PulseChain is a shining example of this potential.

### The Journey of ERC-404: A Token Standard with Promise

The ERC-404 token standard, an intriguing blend of ERC-20 tokens and NFTs, represents a novel approach in the crypto space. While initial tokens like Pandora and DeFrogs have experienced market fluctuations, it's important to remember that such movements are typical in the innovative crypto market.

### RH404 on PulseChain: A Success Story

Amidst the landscape of ERC-404, the launch of RH404 on PulseChain stands out as a beacon of success. This initiative has not only captured the attention of investors but has also delivered impressive returns, showcasing the vibrant potential of new technologies in the crypto market.

### The Future is Bright with DN-404

As we look forward, the development of "Divisible NFT" (DN-404) promises to build upon the foundations of ERC-404, offering an even more efficient and scalable solution. This development is a testament to the relentless innovation in the crypto community.

### Stay Connected for More Updates

To keep up with these exciting developments and more, I invite you to follow my social media channels. Here, you'll find the latest insights, updates, and discussions on the ever-evolving world of cryptocurrency. Join the conversation and be part of this thrilling journey!
